channel.description:
http://blogs.alternet.org/penucquem/2010/10/26/covered-up-more-than-13-of-american-woman-soldiers-raped/
A congresswoman said Thursday that her “jaw dropped” when military doctors told her that four in 10 women at a veterans hospital reported being sexually assaulted while in the military. A government report indicates that the numbers could be even higher. Rep. Jane Harman, D-California, spoke before a House panel investigating the way the military handles reports of sexual assault. “My jaw dropped when the doctors told me that 41 percent of the female veterans seen there say they were victims of sexual assault while serving in the military,” said Harman, who has long sought better protection of women in the military. “We have an epidemic here,” she said. “Women serving in the U.S. military today are more likely to be raped by a fellow soldier than killed by enemy fire in Iraq.” As of July 24, 100 women had died in Iraq, according to the Pentagon. In 2007, Harman said, only 181 out of 2,212 reports of military sexual assaults, or 8 percent, were referred to courts martial. By comparison, she said, 40 percent of those arrested in the civilian world on such charges are prosecuted.
Holy shit. This is terrible. (inb4 misogynists)

Another example: In America, a lot of youths who commit crimes are sent to psychiatric hospitals. At some institutions they will attempt to force diagnoses upon the patients (fallaciously questioning, for example, making all questions related to a certain mental illness to try and skew the patients input without giving them time to explain) and then give them medication, a lot of which is still being testing. These medications often don’t help, but the patients who want to get out/get high off of the medication will lie and say they do work, and then the findings are reported back to drug companies. Within these institutions often times “therapy” is simply a joke made to appear to be helpful without actually helping at all. A lot of times when people are discharged, they end up doing the same things they did before entering, or worse, and sometimes end up back in the hospital or even prison. If the government or an NGO were to actually attempt to help these so-called ‘troubled youths’ without using them as lab rats, I bet a percentage of U.S. crime, suicide, and abuse rates would dissipate.
